title: Ukrainian filmmaker and detained sailors part of Russia-Ukraine prisoner swap, lawyer says
text:
A Ukranian filmmaker who was imprisoned in Russia and 24 sailors detained last year are among those involved in a prisoner swap between Russia and Ukraine, his lawyer has said.

Oleg Sentsov‘s lawyer, Mark Feygin, said 35 Ukrainians would be transferred from Moscow to Kiev on Saturday.

He said the prisoners include Mr Sentsov, who was convicted of plotting terrorist acts, Ukrainian journalist Roman Suschenko and 24 sailors who were seized in the Kerch Strait by Russia in November last year.

Buses from a Moscow prison believed to be carrying Ukrainian prisoners arrived at the capital’s Vnukovo airport on Saturday, Russia’s Interfax news agency reported.

Meanwhile, a plane with Ukrainian government markings landed at the same airport, the agency said.

The plane later took off on its way to Kiev, the Tass news agency reported.

At the same time, a Russian plane left Kiev’s Borispol airport, Ukrainian officials said.

It was not clear who was on board the Russian plane, aside from Kirill Vyshinsky, head of the Russian state news agency RIA-Novosti’s Ukraine branch, who had been jailed since 2018 on treason charges.

His presence was confirmed by Dmitry Kiselev, head of the Rossiya Segodnya media group that includes the agency.

Such an exchange could be a significant step towards easing relations between the two countries and raising the likelihood of resolving the conflict in Ukraine’s east, where fighting between troops and Russia-backed separatists has killed more than 13,000 people since 2014.

Ukraine still wants the Crimea region back, which Russia annexed in 2014, and Russian-backed separatists continue to control a swath of eastern Ukraine.

On Thursday, Vladimir Putin, Russia’s president, said the prisoner exchange would be “a good step forward towards the normalisation [of relations],” adding he expected large numbers of prisoners to be involved.
description: A Ukranian filmmaker who was imprisoned in Russia and 24 sailors detained last year are among those involved in a prisoner swap between Russia and Ukraine, his lawyer has said. Oleg Sentsov‘s lawyer, Mark Feygin, said 35 Ukrainians would be transferred from Moscow to Kiev on Saturday.
